SUB-THEMES
Among the areas of concern under the general theme which
are manifestly appropriate for examination are (1) science and
the substantive consequences of scientific inquiry, (2) the char¬
acteristics and meaning of the arts of our time, (3) the whole
range of interpersonal and group relationships facing today’s
American, including his role in the world community, and (4)
the contemporary American’s ideas—his philosophy, his idea of
God, his moral values, what he owes to the past, what he de¬
rives from it.
THE PLAN
The support plan for educational radio programs is divided
into two parts. The first makes available grants-in-aid to appro¬
priate organizations to help them in producing significant pro¬
grams of their own creation; the second part provides for the
commissioning of program production on specified subjects
within the thematic framework as outlined.
PART 1-1958 GRANTS-IN-AID
Applications for 1958 grants-in-aid will be accepted through
May 1, 1958, and the announcement of grant awards will be
made on June 15, 1958. The following rules and procedures
govern the grant-in-aid program:
1. All applications for grants must be submitted in accord¬
ance with the following conditions to:
THE NATIONAL ASSOCIATION OF EDUCATIONAL
BROADCASTERS
14 Gregory Hall, Urbana, Illinois
2. All applications must be for a grant to help produce a
series of educational radio programs for adult or school
audiences under the theme The American in the Twentieth
Century and with close adherence to the principles and
objectives stated in this announcement.
